languages.text:
Эффекты периодического урона наносят существу заданное количество урона в начале его {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}хода{/g}.
Могут сниматься предметами или способностями.
Например, эффект {g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}кровотечение{/g} наносит урон в начале хода и имеет бесконечную длительность, но может быть снят с помощью медкомплекта.
Для некоторых эффектов, наносящих урон ({g|Encyclopedia:ToxinEffect}отравление{/g}, кровотечение, {g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}горение{/g} и т. д.), рядом указана интенсивность.
Например: горение (4) означает, что эффект наносит 4 урона каждый ход, пока не будет снят.
На это значение могут влиять различные {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}таланты{/g}, способности и предметы снаряжения.
Интенсивность не суммируется. При наложении эффекта с большей интенсивностью он заменяет аналогичный эффект с меньшей интенсивностью.
Например, если существо, на которое действует горение (5), атаковано из огнемета, накладывающего горение (6), то на существо будет действовать горение (6). Если после этого существо атакуют из огнемета с горением (3), на него по-прежнему будет действовать горение (6).
Модификаторы {g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}характеристик{/g} и параметров могут как понижать какие-либо показатели персонажа, так и повышать их. Обычно они являются временными и снимаются через определенное количество раундов или в конце боя. Например, эффект {g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}ослепление{/g} понижает {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Ближний Бой{/g} и {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Дальний Бой{/g} на 30, а шанс {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}уклонения{/g} и {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}парирования{/g} — на 30%.
Для всех эффектов минимальное значение характеристики равно 1. Никакой эффект не может снизить характеристику ниже этого значения.
Контроль лишает персонажа возможности совершать какие-либо действия.
Такие статусы всегда имеют ограниченное время действия.
Например, эффект {g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}обездвиживание{/g} лишает персонажа {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}способности{/g} перемещаться.

A damage-over-time {g|Encyclopedia:CommonStatusesGlossary}effect{/g} deals a certain amount of damage to the afflicted character at the start of their {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}.
Such effects can be removed by using items or {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}abilities{/g}.
For example, the {g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}bleeding{/g} effect deals damage at the start of each of the character's turns and lasts indefinitely, but bleeding can be removed with a medikit.
Some damaging status effects: {g|Encyclopedia:ToxinEffect}toxin{/g}, bleeding, {g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}burning{/g}, etc. have a number indicating its power.
For example, burning (4) means that this effect will deal 4 damage every turn, until it is removed.
This number can be modified by a variety of {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}talents{/g}, abilities, or equipment that can increase or decrease the power of the effect.
You cannot stack the same effect, but stronger sources of the effect override weaker when applied.
For example, if a creature currently suffering from burning (5) is attacked with a flamer with burning (6), it will suffer burning (6) effect. If it is attacked after that with a flamer with burning (3), it will still have burning (6) effect.
{g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}Characteristic{/g} and parameter modifiers can reduce or boost certain character stats. They generally last a limited time and are removed after a certain number of {g|Encyclopedia:Round}rounds{/g} have passed or at the end of combat. An example of such an effect is {g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}blinded{/g}, which reduces the character's {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Weapon Skill{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Ballistic Skill{/g} by −30 and their {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodge{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}parry{/g} chance by −30%.
1 is the lowest possible value of a characteristic. No effect can reduce a characteristic below 1.
Control effects rob the character of the ability to perform certain actions.
These effects always have a limited duration.
For example, the {g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}immobilised{/g} effect prevents the character from moving.
languages.original_text:
Эффекты периодического урона наносят владельцу заданное количество урона в начале его хода.
Могут сниматься предметами или спасбросками.
Например, эффект кровотечение наносит урон в начале хода и имеет бесконечную длительность, но может быть снят с помощью медкомплекта.
Модификаторы характеристик и параметров могут как понижать какие-то характеристики персонажа, так и повышать их. Обычно они являются временными и снимаются через определенное количество ходов или в конце боя. Например, эффект ослепление понижает Ближний Бой и Дальний Бой на 30, а шанс уклонения и парирования — на 30%.
Для всех эффектов минимальное значение характеристики равно 1. Никакой эффект не может снизить характеристику ниже этого значения.
Контроль лишает персонажа возможности совершать какие-либо действия.
Такие статусы всегда имеют ограниченное время действия.
Например, эффект обездвиживание лишает персонажа способности перемещаться.

traits.locale_text:
A damage-over-time effect deals a certain amount of damage to the character afflicted with it at the start of their turn.
Such effects can be removed by using items or abilities.
For example, the bleeding effect deals damage at the start of each of the character's turns and lasts indefinitely, but bleeding can be removed with a medikit.
Characteristic and parameter modifiers can reduce or boost certain character stats. They generally last a limited time and are removed after a certain number number of rounds have passed or at the end of combat. An example of such an effect is blinded, which reduces the character's Weapon Skill and Ballistic Skill by −30 and their dodge and parry chance by −30%.
The lowest value a stat can be reduced to is 1. No effect can reduce a character stat below 1.
Control effects rob the character of the ability to perform certain actions.
These effects always have a limited duration.
For example, the immobilised effect prevents the character from moving.

A damage-over-time effect deals a certain amount of damage to the character afflicted with it at the start of their turn.
Such effects can be removed by using items or abilities.
For example, the bleeding effect deals damage at the start of each of the character's turns and lasts indefinitely, but bleeding can be removed with a medikit.
Characteristic and parameter modifiers can reduce or boost certain character stats. They generally last a limited time and are removed after a certain number number of rounds have passed or at the end of combat. An example of such an effect is blinded, which reduces the character's Weapon Skill and Ballistic Skill by −30 and their dodge and parry chance by −30%.
The lowest value a stat can be reduced to is 1. No effect can reduce a character stat below 1.
Control effects rob the character of the ability to perform certain actions.
These effects always have a limited duration.
For example, the immobilised effect prevents the character from moving.

A damage-over-time effect deals a certain amount of damage to the afflicted character at the start of their turn.
Such effects can be removed by using items or abilities.
For example, the bleeding effect deals damage at the start of each of the character's turns and lasts indefinitely, but bleeding can be removed with a medikit.
Characteristic and parameter modifiers can reduce or boost certain character stats. They generally last a limited time and are removed after a certain number of rounds have passed or at the end of combat. An example of such an effect is blinded, which reduces the character's Weapon Skill and Ballistic Skill by −30 and their dodge and parry chance by −30%.
1 is the lowest possible value of a stat. No effect can reduce a character's stat below 1.
Control effects rob the character of the ability to perform certain actions.
These effects always have a limited duration.
For example, the immobilised effect prevents the character from moving.

A damage-over-time effect deals a certain amount of damage to the afflicted character at the start of their turn.
Such effects can be removed by using items or abilities.
For example, the bleeding effect deals damage at the start of each of the character's turns and lasts indefinitely, but bleeding can be removed with a medikit.
Characteristic and parameter modifiers can reduce or boost certain character stats. They generally last a limited time and are removed after a certain number of rounds have passed or at the end of combat. An example of such an effect is blinded, which reduces the character's Weapon Skill and Ballistic Skill by −30 and their dodge and parry chance by −30%.
1 is the lowest possible value of a stat. No effect can reduce a character's stat below 1.
Control effects rob the character of the ability to perform certain actions.
These effects always have a limited duration.
For example, the immobilised effect prevents the character from moving.

Such effects can be removed by using items or {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}abilities{/g}.
For example, the {g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}bleeding{/g} effect deals damage at the start of each of the character's turns and lasts indefinitely, but bleeding can be removed with a medikit.
Some damaging status effects: {g|Encyclopedia:ToxinEffect}toxin{/g}, bleeding, {g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}burning{/g}, etc. have a number indicating its power.
For example, burning (4) means that this effect will deal 4 damage every turn, until it is removed.
This number can be modified by a variety of {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}talents{/g}, abilities, or equipment that can increase or decrease the power of the effect.
You cannot stack the same effect, but stronger sources of the effect override weaker when applied.
For example, if a creature currently suffering from burning (5) is attacked with a flamer with burning (6), it will suffer burning (6) effect. If it is attacked after that with a flamer with burning (3), it will still have burning (6) effect.
{g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}Characteristic{/g} and parameter modifiers can reduce or boost certain character stats. They generally last a limited time and are removed after a certain number of {g|Encyclopedia:Round}rounds{/g} have passed or at the end of combat. An example of such an effect is {g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}blinded{/g}, which reduces the character's {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Weapon Skill{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Ballistic Skill{/g} by −30 and their {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodge{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}parry{/g} chance by −30%.
1 is the lowest possible value of a characteristic. No effect can reduce a characteristic below 1.
Control effects rob the character of the ability to perform certain actions.
These effects always have a limited duration.
For example, the {g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}immobilised{/g} effect prevents the character from moving.

languages.text:
Ein Schaden über Zeit-{g|Encyclopedia:CommonStatusesGlossary}Effekt{/g} fügt dem betroffenen Ziel zu Beginn seines {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}Zuges{/g} Schaden zu.
Derartige Effekte können mit Gegenständen oder {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}Fähigkeiten{/g} entfernt werden.
Der {g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}Blutung{/g}-Effekt verursacht beispielsweise Schaden zu Beginn jedes Zuges des Charakters und dauert unbegrenzt an. Allerdings kann die Blutung mit einem Medikit gestillt werden.
Einige Schaden-Statuseffekte wie {g|Encyclopedia:ToxinEffect}Gift{/g}, Blutung, {g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}Verbrennung{/g} usw. zeigen mittels einer Zahl ihre Macht an.
Verbrennung (4) heißt beispielsweise, dass dieser Effekt pro Zug 4 Schaden verursacht, bis er entfernt wird.
Diese Zahl kann mit verschiedenen {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}Talenten{/g}, Fähigkeiten oder Ausrüstungsobjekten modifiziert werden, die die Wirksamkeit des Effektes erhöhen oder senken.
Du kannst denselben Effekt nicht stapeln, aber stärkere Quellen des Effektes können schwächere ersetzen.
Wird eine mit Verbrennung (5) belegte Kreatur mit einem Flammenwerfer mit Verbrennung (6) attackiert, wird sie mit dem Verbrennung (6)-Effekt belegt. Wird sie anschließend mit einem Flammenwerfer mit Verbrennung (3) angegriffen, bleibt der Verbrennung (6)-Effekt aktiv.
{g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}Eigenschaften{/g} Parameter-Modifikatoren können bestimmte Charakterwerte senken oder erhöhen. Sie haben generell eine begrenzte Laufzeit und werden nach einer vorgegebenen zahl von {g|Encyclopedia:Round}Runden{/g} oder am Ende des Kampfes entfernt. Ein Beispiel für einen solchen Effekt ist {g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}Geblendet{/g}, das die {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Waffenfähigkeit{/g} und die {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Ballistik-Fähigkeit{/g} des Charakters um −30 und seine {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}Ausweichen-{/g} und {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}Parieren{/g}-Chance um −30 % reduziert.
1 ist der niedrigste mögliche Wert einer Eigenschaft. Kein Effekt kann eine Eigenschaft unter 1 senken.
Kontrolleffekte rauben dem Charakter die Fähigkeit, bestimmte Aktionen auszuführen.Diese Effekte haben immer eine begrenzte Dauer.
Der {g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}Bewegungsunfähig{/g}-Effekt lähmt die Bewegungen des Charakters.
languages.original_text:
A damage-over-time {g|Encyclopedia:CommonStatusesGlossary}effect{/g} deals a certain amount of damage to the afflicted character at the start of their {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}.
Such effects can be removed by using items or {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}abilities{/g}.
For example, the {g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}bleeding{/g} effect deals damage at the start of each of the character's turns and lasts indefinitely, but bleeding can be removed with a medikit.
Some damaging status effects: {g|Encyclopedia:ToxinEffect}toxin{/g}, bleeding, {g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}burning{/g}, etc. have a number indicating its power.
For example, burning (4) means that this effect will deal 4 damage every turn, until it is removed.
This number can be modified by a variety of {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}talents{/g}, abilities, or equipment that can increase or decrease the power of the effect.
You cannot stack the same effect, but stronger sources of the effect override weaker when applied.
For example, if a creature currently suffering from burning (5) is attacked with a flamer with burning (6), it will suffer burning (6) effect. If it is attacked after that with a flamer with burning (3), it will still have burning (6) effect.
{g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}Characteristic{/g} and parameter modifiers can reduce or boost certain character stats. They generally last a limited time and are removed after a certain number of {g|Encyclopedia:Round}rounds{/g} have passed or at the end of combat. An example of such an effect is {g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}blinded{/g}, which reduces the character's {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Weapon Skill{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Ballistic Skill{/g} by −30 and their {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodge{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}parry{/g} chance by −30%.
1 is the lowest possible value of a characteristic. No effect can reduce a characteristic below 1.
Control effects rob the character of the ability to perform certain actions.
These effects always have a limited duration.
For example, the {g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}immobilised{/g} effect prevents the character from moving.

traits.locale_text:
Ein Verlaufsschaden-{g|Encyclopedia:CommonStatuses}Effekt{/g} verursacht einen bestimmten Schadensbetrag beim belegten Charakter zu Beginn dessen {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}Zuges{/g}..
Solche Effekte können durch Gegenstände oder {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}Fähigkeiten{/g} entfernt werden..
Zum Beispiel verursacht der Effekt {g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}Blutung{/g} zu Beginn jedes Zuges des Charakters Schaden und dauert unbegrenzt an, kann jedoch mit einem Medikit entfernt werden.
Eigenschafts- und Parametermodifikatoren können bestimmte Charakterwerte reduzieren oder erhöhen. Sie halten gewöhnlich eine begrenzte Zeit an und werden nach Ablauf einer bestimmten Anzahl {g|Encyclopedia:Round}Runden{/g} oder nach Kampfende entfernt. Ein Beispiel für einen solchen Effekt ist {g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}Geblendet{/g}, der die {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Waffenfähigkeit{/g} und {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Ballistik-Fähigkeit{/g} des Charakters um -30 sowie seine Chance auf {g|Encyclopedia:Dodge}Ausweichen{/g} und {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}Parieren{/g} um -30 % reduziert.
1 ist die kleinstmögliche Zahl eines Werts. Kein Effekt kann einen Charakterwert unter 1 fallen lassen.
Kontrolleffekte nehmen dem Charakter die Fähigkeit, bestimmte Aktionen auszuführen.
Diese Effekte sind immer zeitlich begrenzt.
Zum Beispiel hindert der Effekt {g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}Gelähmt{/g} den Charakter daran, sich zu bewegen.

Ein Schaden über Zeit-{g|Encyclopedia:CommonStatusesGlossary}Effekt{/g} fügt dem betroffenen Ziel zu Beginn seines {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}Zuges{/g} Schaden zu.
Derartige Effekte können mit Gegenständen oder {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}Fähigkeiten{/g} entfernt werden.
Der {g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}Blutung{/g}-Effekt verursacht beispielsweise Schaden zu Beginn jedes Zuges des Charakters und dauert unbegrenzt an. Allerdings kann die Blutung mit einem Medikit gestillt werden.
Einige Schaden-Statuseffekte wie {g|Encyclopedia:ToxinEffect}Gift{/g}, Blutung, {g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}Verbrennung{/g} usw. zeigen mittels einer Zahl ihre Macht an.
Verbrennung (4) heißt beispielsweise, dass dieser Effekt pro Zug 4 Schaden verursacht, bis er entfernt wird.
Diese Zahl kann mit verschiedenen {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}Talenten{/g}, Fähigkeiten oder Ausrüstungsobjekten modifiziert werden, die die Wirksamkeit des Effektes erhöhen oder senken.
Du kannst denselben Effekt nicht stapeln, aber stärkere Quellen des Effektes können schwächere ersetzen.
Wird eine mit Verbrennung (5) belegte Kreatur mit einem Flammenwerfer mit Verbrennung (6) attackiert, wird sie mit dem Verbrennung (6)-Effekt belegt. Wird sie anschließend mit einem Flammenwerfer mit Verbrennung (3) angegriffen, bleibt der Verbrennung (6)-Effekt aktiv.
{g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}Eigenschaften{/g} Parameter-Modifikatoren können bestimmte Charakterwerte senken oder erhöhen. Sie haben generell eine begrenzte Laufzeit und werden nach einer vorgegebenen zahl von {g|Encyclopedia:Round}Runden{/g} oder am Ende des Kampfes entfernt. Ein Beispiel für einen solchen Effekt ist {g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}Geblendet{/g}, das die {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Waffenfähigkeit{/g} und die {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Ballistik-Fähigkeit{/g} des Charakters um -30 und seine {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}Ausweichen-{/g} und {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}Parieren{/g}-Chance um -30 % reduziert.
1 ist der niedrigste mögliche Wert einer Eigenschaft. Kein Effekt kann eine Eigenschaft unter 1 senken.
Kontrolleffekte rauben dem Charakter die Fähigkeit, bestimmte Aktionen auszuführen.Diese Effekte haben immer eine begrenzte Dauer.
Der {g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}Bewegungsunfähig{/g}-Effekt lähmt die Bewegungen des Charakters.

languages.text:
Un {g|Encyclopedia:CommonStatusesGlossary}effet{/g} de dégâts progressifs inflige un certain nombre de dégâts au personnage touché au début de son {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}tour{/g}.
L'utilisation d'objets ou de {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}capacités{/g} peut neutraliser de tels effets.
Ainsi, l'effet {g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}Saignement{/g} inflige des dégâts au début de chaque tour du personnage et dure indéfiniment, mais un médikit peut arrêter l'hémorragie.
Certains effets d'état infligeant des dégâts ({g|Encyclopedia:ToxinEffect}Toxine{/g}, Saignement, {g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}Combustion{/g}, etc.) sont suivis d'une valeur représentant leur intensité.
Par exemple, Combustion (4) signifie que cet effet infligera 4 points de dégâts par tour jusqu'à ce qu'il se dissipe.
Différents {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}talents{/g}, capacités et équipements peuvent modifier cette valeur et ainsi augmenter ou réduire l'intensité de l'effet.
S'il est impossible de cumuler un même effet, tout effet plus puissant du même type remplace une éventuelle version inférieure lorsqu'il est appliqué.
Ainsi, si une créature subissant l'effet Combustion (5) est attaquée avec un lance-flammes infligeant de Combustion (6), elle sera frappée par l'effet Combustion (6). Si elle est ensuite attaquée avec un lance-flammes infligeant Combustion (3), elle conservera l'effet Combustion (6).
Les modificateurs de {g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}caractéristiques{/g} et de paramètres peuvent réduire ou augmenter certaines statistiques du personnage. Ils ont généralement une durée limitée et se dissipent au bout d'un certain nombre de {g|Encyclopedia:Round}rounds{/g} ou à la fin du combat. L'effet {g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}Aveuglement{/g}, qui réduit la {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Compétence d'arme{/g} et la {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Compétence balistique{/g} du personnage de −30 et ses chances d'{g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}Esquive{/g} et de {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}Parade{/g} de −30 %, en est une illustration.
La valeur minimale d'une caractéristique est de 1. Aucun effet ne peut donc la réduire en dessous de 1.
Les effets de contrôle empêchent le personnage d'effectuer certaines actions.
Ces effets ont toujours une durée limitée.
Par exemple, l'effet {g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}Immobilisation{/g} empêche le personnage de se déplacer.

traits.locale_text:
Un {g|Encyclopedia:CommonStatusesGlossary}effet{/g} de dégâts progressifs inflige un certain nombre de dégâts au personnage touché au début de son {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}tour{/g}.
L'utilisation d'objets ou de {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}capacités{/g} permet de neutraliser ces effets.
Par exemple, l'effet {g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}Saignement{/g} inflige des dégâts au début de chaque tour du personnage et dure indéfiniment, mais un médikit permet d'arrêter l'hémorragie.
Certains effets d'état infligeant des dégâts ({g|Encyclopedia:ToxinEffect}Toxine{/g}, Saignement, {g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}Combustion{/g}, etc.) sont suivis d'une valeur représentant leur puissance.
Par exemple, Combustion (4) signifie que cet effet infligera 4 points de dégâts par tour jusqu'à ce qu'il se dissipe.
Différents {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}talents{/g}, capacités et équipements peuvent modifier cette valeur et ainsi augmenter ou réduire la puissance de l'effet.
S'il est impossible de cumuler un même effet, tout effet du même type, mais plus puissant remplace une éventuelle version inférieure lorsqu’il est appliqué.
Par exemple, si une créature subissant l'effet Combustion (5) est attaquée avec un lance-flammes doté de Combustion (6), elle sera frappée par l'effet Combustion (6). Si elle est ensuite attaquée avec un lance-flammes doté de Combustion (3), elle conservera l'effet Combustion (6).
Les modificateurs de {g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}caractéristiques{/g} et de paramètres peuvent réduire ou augmenter certaines statistiques du personnage. Ils ont généralement une durée limitée et se dissipent au bout d'un certain nombre de {g|Encyclopedia:Round}rounds{/g} ou à la fin du combat. L'effet {g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}Aveuglement{/g}, qui réduit la {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Compétence d'arme{/g} et la {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Compétence balistique{/g} du personnage de −30 et ses chances d'{g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}Esquive{/g} et de {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}Parade{/g} de −30 %, en est une illustration.
La valeur minimale d'une caractéristique est de 1. Aucun effet ne peut donc la réduire en dessous de 1.
Les effets de contrôle empêchent le personnage d'effectuer certaines actions.
Ces effets ont toujours une durée limitée.
Par exemple, l'effet {g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}Immobilisation{/g} empêche le personnage de se déplacer.

languages.text:
当角色受到持续伤害{g|Encyclopedia:CommonStatusesGlossary}效果{/g}影响时，该角色在{g|Encyclopedia:Turn}回合{/g}开始时会受到一定伤害。
此类效果可以通过特定物品或{g|Encyclopedia:Ability}能力{/g}来消除。
例如，{g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}流血{/g}效果会导致角色在每个回合开始时受到伤害，效果会始终持续下去。不过，您可以使用医疗包来移除流血效果。
部分持续伤害效果，如{g|Encyclopedia:ToxinEffect}毒素{/g}、流血、{g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}燃烧{/g}，此效果后面会跟着一个数字，代表效果强度。
例如，燃烧（4）表示该效果每回合可造成4点伤害，直到效果移除为止。
效果强度会受到各种{g|Encyclopedia:Talent}天赋{/g}、异能或装备影响，从而提高或降低效果的威力。
相同的效果无法叠加，当多个效果叠加时，较强的效果会覆盖较弱的效果。
举个例子，假设某个生物受到了燃烧（5）效果影响，之后被带有燃烧（6）效果的火焰喷射器攻击，该生物会受到燃烧（6）效果影响。如果在此之后，该生物又受到带有燃烧（3）效果火焰喷射器的攻击，则该生物仍然受到燃烧（6）效果。
角色{g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}属性{/g}与部分效果可以提高或降低角色的部分属性。此类效果通常只会持续较短一段时间，会在几{g|Encyclopedia:Round}轮{/g}后或战斗结束时消除。例如，{g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}致盲{/g}效果会使角色的{g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}武器技能{/g}与{g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}弹道技能{/g}降低30点，{g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}闪避{/g}与{g|Encyclopedia:Parry}招架{/g}几率降低30%。
属性值最低为1点。任何效果都无法将角色的属性值降至1点以下。
控制效果会剥夺角色执行特定动作的能力。
控制效果的持续时间始终是有限的。
例如，被{g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}定身{/g}的角色无法移动。
languages.original_text:
A damage-over-time {g|Encyclopedia:CommonStatusesGlossary}effect{/g} deals a certain amount of damage to the afflicted character at the start of their {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}.
Such effects can be removed by using items or {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}abilities{/g}.
For example, the {g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}bleeding{/g} effect deals damage at the start of each of the character's turns and lasts indefinitely, but bleeding can be removed with a medikit.
Some damaging status effects: {g|Encyclopedia:ToxinEffect}toxin{/g}, bleeding, {g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}burning{/g}, etc. have a number indicating its power.
For example, burning (4) means that this effect will deal 4 damage every turn, until it is removed.
This number can be modified by a variety of {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}talents{/g}, abilities, or equipment that can increase or decrease the power of the effect.
You cannot stack the same effect, but stronger sources of the effect override weaker when applied.
For example, if a creature currently suffering from burning (5) is attacked with a flamer with burning (6), it will suffer burning (6) effect. If it is attacked after that with a flamer with burning (3), it will still have burning (6) effect.
{g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}Characteristic{/g} and parameter modifiers can reduce or boost certain character stats. They generally last a limited time and are removed after a certain number of {g|Encyclopedia:Round}rounds{/g} have passed or at the end of combat. An example of such an effect is {g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}blinded{/g}, which reduces the character's {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Weapon Skill{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Ballistic Skill{/g} by −30 and their {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodge{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}parry{/g} chance by −30%.
1 is the lowest possible value of a characteristic. No effect can reduce a characteristic below 1.
Control effects rob the character of the ability to perform certain actions.
These effects always have a limited duration.
For example, the {g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}immobilised{/g} effect prevents the character from moving.

traits.locale_text:
当角色受到持续伤害{g|Encyclopedia:CommonStatusesGlossary}效果{/g}影响时，该角色在{g|Encyclopedia:Turn}回合{/g}开始时会受到一定伤害。
此类效果可以通过特定物品或{g|Encyclopedia:Ability}能力{/g}来消除。
例如，{g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}流血{/g}效果会导致角色在每个回合开始时受到伤害，效果会始终持续下去。不过，您可以使用医疗包来移除流血效果。
部分持续伤害效果，如{g|Encyclopedia:ToxinEffect}毒素{/g}、流血、{g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}燃烧{/g}，此效果后面会跟着一个数字，代表效果强度。
例如，燃烧（4）表示该效果每回合可造成4点伤害，直到效果移除为止。
效果强度会受到各种{g|Encyclopedia:Talent}天赋{/g}、异能或装备影响，从而提高或降低效果的威力。
相同的效果无法叠加，当多个效果叠加时，较强的效果会覆盖较弱的效果。
举个例子，假设某个生物受到了燃烧（5）效果影响，之后被带有燃烧（6）效果的火焰喷射器攻击，该生物会受到燃烧（6）效果影响。如果在此之后，该生物又受到带有燃烧（3）效果火焰喷射器的攻击，则该生物仍然受到燃烧（6）效果。
角色{g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}属性{/g}与部分效果可以提高或降低角色的部分属性。此类效果通常只会持续较短一段时间，会在几{g|Encyclopedia:Round}轮{/g}后或战斗结束时消除。例如，{g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}致盲{/g}效果会使角色的{g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}武器技能{/g}与{g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}弹道技能{/g}降低30点，{g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}闪避{/g}与{g|Encyclopedia:Parry}招架{/g}几率降低30%。
属性值最低为1点。任何效果都无法将角色的属性值降至1点以下。
控制效果会剥夺角色执行特定动作的能力。
控制效果的持续时间始终是有限的。
例如，被{g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}定身{/g}的角色无法移动。

languages.text:
Los {g|Encyclopedia:CommonStatusesGlossary}efectos{/g} de daño continuado causan una cantidad de daño concreta al personaje que los sufra cuando comienza su {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turno{/g}.
Esta clase de efectos se pueden eliminar por medio de objetos o {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}capacidades{/g}.
Por ejemplo, el efecto de {g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}hemorragia{/g} inflige daño al comienzo del turno de cada personaje y perdura indefinidamente, pero se puede eliminar con un botiquín.
Algunos efectos de daño continuado, incluyendo {g|Encyclopedia:ToxinEffect}toxina{/g}, hemorragia y {g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}quemadura{/g}, tienen un número que indica la potencia del efecto.
Por ejemplo, quemadura (4) indica que la quemadura infligirá 4 puntos de daño por turno hasta que se elimine.
Este número puede verse afectado por diversos {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}talentos{/g}, capacidades o equipo, aumentando o reduciendo la potencia del efecto.
No se puede acumular el mismo efecto varias veces, pero al aplicar uno más poderoso sustituye al más débil.
Por ejemplo, si una criatura afectada por quemadura (5) sufre el ataque de un lanzallamas con quemadura (6), pasa a sufrir quemadura (6). Si después recibe el ataque de otro lanzallamas que solo tiene quemadura (3), seguirá sufriendo quemadura (6)
Ciertas estadísticas del personaje pueden verse reducidas o potenciadas por modificadores de {g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}características{/g} y parámetros. Por regla general, perduran durante un tiempo limitado y se eliminan después de que pase un número determinado de {g|Encyclopedia:Round}asaltos{/g} o al término del combate. Un ejemplo de esta clase de efectos es {g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}cegado{/g}, que reduce la {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Habilidad de armas{/g} y la {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Habilidad de proyectiles{/g} del personaje en −30 y su probabilidad de {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}esquiva{/g} y {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}parada{/g} en un −30 %.
El valor más bajo que puede tener una característica es 1. No existe efecto que reduzca una característica de personaje a menos de 1.
Los efectos de control anulan la capacidad del personaje para realizar ciertas acciones.
Esta clase de efectos tienen una duración limitada.
Por ejemplo, el efecto {g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}Inmovilizado{/g} imposibilita el movimiento del personaje.
languages.original_text:
A damage-over-time {g|Encyclopedia:CommonStatusesGlossary}effect{/g} deals a certain amount of damage to the afflicted character at the start of their {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}.
Such effects can be removed by using items or {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}abilities{/g}.
For example, the {g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}bleeding{/g} effect deals damage at the start of each of the character's turns and lasts indefinitely, but bleeding can be removed with a medikit.
Some damaging status effects: {g|Encyclopedia:ToxinEffect}toxin{/g}, bleeding, {g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}burning{/g}, etc. have a number indicating its power.
For example, burning (4) means that this effect will deal 4 damage every turn, until it is removed.
This number can be modified by a variety of {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}talents{/g}, abilities, or equipment that can increase or decrease the power of the effect.
You cannot stack the same effect, but stronger sources of the effect override weaker when applied.
For example, if a creature currently suffering from burning (5) is attacked with a flamer with burning (6), it will suffer burning (6) effect. If it is attacked after that with a flamer with burning (3), it will still have burning (6) effect.
{g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}Characteristic{/g} and parameter modifiers can reduce or boost certain character stats. They generally last a limited time and are removed after a certain number of {g|Encyclopedia:Round}rounds{/g} have passed or at the end of combat. An example of such an effect is {g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}blinded{/g}, which reduces the character's {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Weapon Skill{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Ballistic Skill{/g} by −30 and their {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodge{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}parry{/g} chance by −30%.
1 is the lowest possible value of a characteristic. No effect can reduce a characteristic below 1.
Control effects rob the character of the ability to perform certain actions.
These effects always have a limited duration.
For example, the {g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}immobilised{/g} effect prevents the character from moving.

traits.locale_text:
Los {g|Encyclopedia:CommonStatusesGlossary}efectos{/g} de daño continuado causan una cantidad de daño concreta al personaje que los sufra cuando comienza su {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turno{/g}.
Esta clase de efectos se pueden eliminar por medio de objetos o {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}capacidades{/g}.
Por ejemplo, el efecto de {g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}hemorragia{/g} inflige daño al comienzo del turno de cada personaje y perdura indefinidamente, pero se puede eliminar con un botiquín.
Algunos efectos de daño continuado, incluyendo {g|Encyclopedia:ToxinEffect}toxina{/g}, hemorragia y {g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}quemadura{/g}, tienen un número que indica la potencia del efecto.
Por ejemplo, quemadura (4) indica que la quemadura infligirá 4 puntos de daño por turno hasta que se elimine.
Este número puede verse afectado por diversos {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}talentos{/g}, capacidades o equipo, aumentando o reduciendo la potencia del efecto.
No se puede acumular el mismo efecto varias veces, pero al aplicar uno más poderoso sustituye al más débil.
Por ejemplo, si una criatura afectada por quemadura (5) sufre el ataque de un lanzallamas con quemadura (6), pasa a sufrir quemadura (6). Si después recibe el ataque de otro lanzallamas que solo tiene quemadura (3), seguirá sufriendo quemadura (6)
Ciertas estadísticas del personaje pueden verse reducidas o potenciadas por modificadores de {g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}características{/g} y parámetros. Por regla general, perduran durante un tiempo limitado y se eliminan después de que pase un número determinado de {g|Encyclopedia:Round}asaltos{/g} o al término del combate. Un ejemplo de esta clase de efectos es {g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}cegado{/g}, que reduce la {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Habilidad de armas{/g} y la {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Habilidad de proyectiles{/g} del personaje en −30 y su probabilidad de {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}esquiva{/g} y {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}parada{/g} en un −30 %.
El valor más bajo que puede tener una característica es 1. No existe efecto que reduzca una característica de personaje a menos de 1.
Los efectos de control anulan la capacidad del personaje para realizar ciertas acciones.
Esta clase de efectos tienen una duración limitada.
Por ejemplo, el efecto {g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}Inmovilizado{/g} imposibilita el movimiento del personaje.

languages.original_text:
Time damage effects deal a set amount of damage to the wielder at the start of their turn.
They can be removed by items or saving throws.
For example, the Bleeding effect deals damage at the beginning of a turn and has an infinite duration, but can be removed with a Medkit.
Character Modifiers and Parameter Modifiers can either lower or raise a character's stats. They are usually temporary and are removed after a certain number of turns or at the end of the battle. For example, the Blindness effect lowers Mideast Combat and Ranged Combat by 30, and the chance to dodge and parry by 30%
All effects have a minimum characteristic value of 1. No effect can reduce a characteristic below this value.
Control removes the character's ability to perform any action.
Such statuses always have a limited duration.
For example, the Immobilisation effect removes the character's ability to move.

languages.text:
継続ダメージ{g|Encyclopedia:CommonStatusesGlossary}効果{/g}により、ダメージを負っているキャラクターに{g|Encyclopedia:Turn}ターン{/g}開始時に特定のダメージ量が付与される。
効果はアイテムもしくは{g|Encyclopedia:Ability}アビリティ{/g}を使用することで解除できる。
例えば、{g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}出血{/g}効果は各キャラクターのターン開始時にダメージを与え際限なく継続するが、メディキットで解除できる。
{g|Encyclopedia:ToxinEffect}毒素{/g}、出血、{g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}炎上{/g}など、一部の状態ダメージ効果には、その威力を示す数値がある。
例えば炎上(4)は、この効果が消えるまで毎ターン、4ダメージ与えることを意味する。
この数値は、効果の威力を増減するさまざまな{g|Encyclopedia:Talent}タレント{/g}、アビリティ、装備の影響で変わる。
同じ効果を蓄積することはできないが、適用されるときは、効果の強い元となるものが弱い方に勝って優先される。
例えば、ある炎上(5)を受けている生物が、炎上(6)を持つフレイマーで攻撃された場合、その生物は炎上(6)の効果を受ける。その後に炎上(3)を持つフレイマーで攻撃された場合でも、炎上(6)の効果が残る。
{g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}ステータス{/g}およびパラメータ修正は、特定のキャラクターステータスを弱体化または強化する。大抵の場合は限られた時間内で継続し、一定の{g|Encyclopedia:Round}ラウンド{/g}数が終わるか戦闘終了時に効果が切れる。こういった効果の例として{g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}盲目{/g}がある。これはキャラクターの{g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}近接攻撃{/g}と{g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}射撃技能{/g}を30%減少、また{g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}回避{/g}および{g|Encyclopedia:Parry}受け流し{/g}の確率を30%減少する。
ステータスの最小値は1である。どの効果でもキャラクターのステータスを1未満にすることはできない。
コントロール効果ではキャラクターから特定のアクションを行うアビリティを奪うことができる。
効果の持続時間には制限がある。
例えば、{g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}移動不可{/g}効果ではキャラクターの移動を阻むことができる。
languages.original_text:
A damage-over-time {g|Encyclopedia:CommonStatusesGlossary}effect{/g} deals a certain amount of damage to the afflicted character at the start of their {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}.
Such effects can be removed by using items or {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}abilities{/g}.
For example, the {g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}bleeding{/g} effect deals damage at the start of each of the character's turns and lasts indefinitely, but bleeding can be removed with a medikit.
Some damaging status effects: {g|Encyclopedia:ToxinEffect}toxin{/g}, bleeding, {g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}burning{/g}, etc. have a number indicating its power.
For example, burning (4) means that this effect will deal 4 damage every turn, until it is removed.
This number can be modified by a variety of {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}talents{/g}, abilities, or equipment that can increase or decrease the power of the effect.
You cannot stack the same effect, but stronger sources of the effect override weaker when applied.
For example, if a creature currently suffering from burning (5) is attacked with a flamer with burning (6), it will suffer burning (6) effect. If it is attacked after that with a flamer with burning (3), it will still have burning (6) effect.
{g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}Characteristic{/g} and parameter modifiers can reduce or boost certain character stats. They generally last a limited time and are removed after a certain number of {g|Encyclopedia:Round}rounds{/g} have passed or at the end of combat. An example of such an effect is {g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}blinded{/g}, which reduces the character's {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Weapon Skill{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Ballistic Skill{/g} by −30 and their {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodge{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}parry{/g} chance by −30%.
1 is the lowest possible value of a characteristic. No effect can reduce a characteristic below 1.
Control effects rob the character of the ability to perform certain actions.
These effects always have a limited duration.
For example, the {g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}immobilised{/g} effect prevents the character from moving.

ステータスの最小値は1である。どの効果でもキャラクターのステータスを1未満にすることはできない。
コントロール効果ではキャラクターから特定のアクションを行うアビリティを奪うことができる。
効果の持続時間には制限がある。
例えば、{g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}移動不可{/g}効果ではキャラクターの移動を阻むことができる。
